author: CavalloneChen
body: I would like to install pwsh on our team's centos server where I have no root privilege. But pwsh only comes with brew/cask, which made it impossible for me to install with linux brew.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
@TravisEz13 Is it possible?

@CavalloneChen You can download zip distributive and unpack it in your folder.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: @CavalloneChen I'm happy for the community to build a formula.  It would not be a Microsoft supported thing as a formula builds the product and we would not have tested those binaries.

comments.author: CavalloneChen
comments.body:
> @CavalloneChen You can download zip distributive and unpack it in your folder.

Yeah, definitely. But my server's system isn't officilay supported and installing dependencies can be a pain.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I guess OpenSSL is single dependency you need and only for remoting.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as answered and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
We could build a formula if it was in our own repo. Would that work? I have a prototype in my personal repo: https://github.com/TravisEz13/Homebrew-PowerShell
GitHub
TravisEz13/Homebrew-PowerShell
Contribute to TravisEz13/Homebrew-PowerShell development by creating an account on GitHub.

title: Please add brew(not cask) formula
